com.conceptwave.scripting
Class FileReader

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.FileReader

public class FileReader
extends CWScriptable

Input file manipulation class. Construction of a FileReader is done as follows: new FileReader(filename) where filename is the filename to read. If the file does not exist an exception will not be thrown until an attempt is made to access the file. Note that the default character set encoding is Cp1252.

Field Detail

charset

public String charset
READWRITE: Gets the character set encoding. After reading begins, changes to the character set are ignored. Sets the character set encoding. After reading begins, changes to the character set are ignored.

getFileName

getItemsFromXML

public static Array getItemsFromXML(String fileName,
                                    String name)
Opens a XML file and converts it to list of data objects - documents, orders and data structures.

Parameters:
fileName - String XML file name.
name - String Can be a fully specified document type, namespace or null. If the parameter is fully qualified metadata document name the input XML file is scanned for the instances of that document type and array of documents are returned. If the parameter is namespace name the top level element of the XML file is considered to be order, data structure or document of this namespace. If such metadata element exists it is converted to data object and an array of one element is returned. If no metadata element mactches the top level XML element null is returned. If the parameter is null then the xmlns element of the XML is used to find the corresponding metadata namespace. If found the result is the same as if the namespace name is specified. If no matching namespace is found or xmlns element is not specified null is returned.
Returns:
Array Array of data objects or null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws different I/O or data format exceptions.

getItemsFromXML

public Array getItemsFromXML(String name)
Converts the current XML file to list of data objects - documents, orders and data structures.

Parameters:
name - String Can be a fully specified document type, namespace or null. If the parameter is fully qualified metadata document name the input XML file is scanned for the instances of that document type and array of documents are returned. If the parameter is namespace name the top level element of the XML file is considered to be order, data structure or document of this namespace. If such metadata element exists it is converted to data object and an array of one element is returned. If no metadata element mactches the top level XML element null is returned. If the parameter is null then the xmlns element of the XML is used to find the corresponding metadata namespace. If found the result is the same as if the namespace name is specified. If no matching namespace is found or xmlns element is not specified null is returned.
Returns:
Array Array of data objects or null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws different I/O or data format exceptions.

newLineEx

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean newLineEx(String sep,
                                                   String term,
                                                   String quotation)
Positions the file on the beginning of the next value separated record. A record may consists of several lines of text.

Parameters:
sep - String Separator character. If null, defaults to comma.
term - String Line termination character. If null, defaults to \n.
quotation - String Value delimiter character. If null, defaults to double quotation mark.
Returns:
boolean True if end of file is reached.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws different types of exceptions if I/O error or field format errors are encountered.

readDoc

public Document readDoc(String docName,
                        com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean fixedFlag)
Reads a document from the file. Start the reading from the next line or separated vbalue record.

Parameters:
docName - String Fully specified metadata document name.
fixedFlag - boolean If the metadata does not specify file format asumes a fixed file format if the value of the parameter is true or CSV (Comma Separated Value) format if the parameter is false.
Returns:
Document A document or null if end of file is reached.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws different types of exceptions if I/O error or field format errors are encountered.

readLine

public String readLine()
Read the next line from the file.

Returns:
String Line content as string without the line terminating character(s) or null if the end of the file is reached.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - May throw I/O exceptions.

readLineEx

public String readLineEx(String sep,
                         String term,
                         String quotation)
Reads the next CSV record in a string. The record may contain more than one line.

Parameters:
sep - String Field separator character. If null specified default to comma.
term - String Line termination character. If null is specified default to \n.
quotation - String Value delimiter character. If null specified default to double quotation mark.
Returns:
String A string containing the record or null if end of file is reached.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - May throw I/O exceptions.
